intro: Caralluma munbyana, commonly known as the Indian devil's backbone, is a succulent plant native to the arid regions of India and Nepal. It belongs to the family Nyctaginaceae and is characterized by its spine-tipped stems and clusters of small, fleshy leaves. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom during the warmer months. Due to its unique appearance and resilience, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in xerophytic gardens.
